intro: Dichilus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered dichilus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in a variety of soil types, including sandy and rocky soils. Dichilus multiflorus is often found in open woodland and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
